Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as bad as it's made out here...”
Reviews.Author: Dan77Caracas
Reviews.Content: After reading the recent reviews, I had a lot of trepidation about staying here for 2 weeks while working nearby (I'd moved from a similar place near the Angel to be closer to our office). While I would rather have been at the W, Intercon or JW Marriott, all of which are nearby, I really couldn't complain. My room - 316 - was large enough and recently refurbished. Everything was comfortable and clean, and there was a big new flatscreen TV with some HD channels. The staff were friendly (I speak Spanish), and the surrounding area is great. You're one block from the French embassy, a block from lovely Lincoln Park, and 2-3 blocks from the city's most glitzy shops. Gripes: no wi-fi, so you have to use the 'business center' downstairs which has a couple of desktops, breakfast is a joke (mini-muffins, sunny delight and coffee laid out on a table near reception, and fyi, the Italian restaurant next door shuts at 7pm on Sundays. The restaurant is wonderful, and there's a side entrance from inside the hotel lobby - but you can't charge meals to your room. To sum up: clean, friendly and perfectly adequate in a very fancy neighborhood. But if you're looking to treat yourself, look a bit more upmarket (and spend a bit more).

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, for a reason”
Reviews.Author: G9508
Reviews.Content: The price is low, compared with the luxury skyscrappers in the surrounding neighborhoods, and there is a good reason for that. This hotel looks very provincial and badly needs renovation. The hotel has an Internet site, providing online reservations. However, I am not sure that anybody noticed the reservation that I placed and prepaid. Fortunately enough a suitable room was found. With all that the room was clean and the staff polite. The neighborhood is green and quiet, probably one of the best one can find in the city. Internet connection was free and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Adams Family Experience”
Reviews.Author: Viaticatus
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at the Polanco and was possibly the worst. My room had a tiny, backdated, poorly designed bathroom. I could not sit in the toilet without banging my nees with the lavatory. The room was not clean, had pubic hairs in the sheets, and had a "dirty" smell. Location is great, restaurant is good, but the overall experience is very poor. I hope I never stay there again-

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice if you expect American style lodging”
Reviews.Author: travel49424
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel; the first stay was just a quick one nighter; this time I stayed for two nights. The hotel, as other reviewers have noted, is dated and old. I stayed in a room on the 2nd floor which proved to be quite noisy--you could hear the street noise quite easily and it woke me up once in the middle of the night. The room I stayed in clearly was extra space converted to a room. When I sat on the toilet my knees banged up against the wall; and I'm 5'11--not that tall! The bed was absolutely terrible, rock hard, if I had a sleeping bag I would have slept in it on the floor and probably would have been more comfortable. The lighting in the room isn't that great either; especially if you plan on doing some work by the meager desk. I opted to stay at this place because the other big chains in the area seemed real expensive especially for Mexico City. But avoid this place. It's basically got the charm of a Motel 6 or Super 8. The only positive about this place is the adjacent Italian restaurant (which isn't owned by the hotel) is a pretty good place for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting friends”
Reviews.Author: Hostamanfred
Reviews.Content: The dining room lends itself to connecting with other traverse and share experiences. The evening meal can easily stretch into many hours.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff, but outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tiffanyjax
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are very outdated, but clean. The staff is very nice & helpful. The hotel is in a very good area that is safe and has a lot to do. I stayed 3 nights and then moved to a larger hotel. I was on business and need a better bed/shower. If I had been on vacation, this hotel would have been fine. Good Price.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: judgereferee
Reviews.Content: We were terribly disappointed with this hotel. The rooms are small European style) which we expected from other reviews but they are poorly laid out-(one with a large step into the bathroom which caused my partner to hit his head) but that was not the real reason this hotel was terrible. The rooms were dirty. I took a sanitizing cloth and wiped many surfaces. Within seconds, my cloth was filthy> I brought it to the front desk..they moved us into an equally dirty room. The bedspread had stains. The mold was thick and stained in the shower. It was really unacceptable. Not all but most of the front desk staff were either rude or inaccurate with information shared. They were not very "Norte" friendly which after spending a week in Merida, Yuctean was real shock. This is my fourth trip to DF and the ONLY time I have received such treatment. I would not recommend this hotel for friendliness or cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed about Polanco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tecouag
Reviews.Content: I will explain you my experience in this hotel this simple, I leave the hotel 1 hour after arriving to it. They charged 120 USD for such a simple hotel, small room, horrible view of room, everything is extremelly simple, including the faucets, sanitaryware and even the soaps. The location is very nice, in the middle of one of the nicest places in Mexico City, but if you are used to luxury, this is not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, if a bit rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: bstnnrdgrl
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Polanco because it appears to be independently- and Mexican-owned, is in a safe and quiet location, and seemed reasonably-priced. On those counts, we werenâ€™t disappointed (although in the end the price seemed a tad high, considering the fact that it is a no-frills hotel). The staff, especially in the restaurant, were quite pleasant. The gym and Internet rooms were adequate. The hotel is within easy walking distance of shops, restaurants, and even the Metro (about 15 min. away) and Anthropological and Modern Art Museums (about 1/2 an hour). Itâ€™s just a short taxi-and-Metro ride to the historical center (thereâ€™s a sitio nearby, too), and we made it to the airport in about half an hour (though be aware that this was on a Sunday morning). I (a 30-something woman) felt perfectly safe walking around by myself. We didnâ€™t feel that the rooms were too small; they were modest, but clean and comfortable, although the mattresses were a bit too hard, there was no bathtub, and there was a rather steep step leading down from the bathroom to the main area. We were very pleased that they gave us what seemed to be the quietest possible room (facing the inside courtyard). We only visited the restaurant for breakfast, and found that to be middling, but at least there was a lot of choice on the menu. One inconvenience was that no one spoke English very well. They were very patient with my terrible Spanish, though, and so I could usually make myself understood (although there was one frustrating mishap when I, dutiful gringa that I am, came down with the inevitable stomach bug. I called room service and asked for agua caliente para tÃ©. They promptly sent up a plumber, who checked the water in our bathroom and found that it was indeed caliente. When I tried to explain that that wasnâ€™t the problem, he said Iâ€™d have to go down to the restaurant myself. I was in no position to do this. Fortunately, a Mexican friend was able to call in and straighten out the situation, and soon the maitre dâ€™ himself appeared at my door with a tray of tea and Coke). In their defense, it appears that just about all of their clients are local businesspeople, so thereâ€™s no real need for them to speak English. And I have to say that it was nice both to be surrounded by locals and not to have to listen to screaming children. The only real annoyance was the message-retrieval system. When someone leaves a message for you, your room phone flashes and beeps incessantly until you call the front desk and ask them to retrieve the message. Bizarrely, they appear to do this by listening to the message while they play it to you over the phone (as evidenced by the background noise I could hear when our messages were played, and by Receptionâ€™s asking whether I wanted him to erase the message after heâ€™d played it). I suppose if you have nothing to hide, thereâ€™s nothing wrong with this system, but it can be a little embarrassing. And it often happened that the damn thing would continue to beep after weâ€™d hung up. We could hear these beeps emanating from other peopleâ€™s rooms as we walked down the hall and always hoped--nay, prayed--that they werenâ€™t for us... On balance, a good choice for businesspeople and couples who are looking for some peace and quiet in a very busy city.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 'just came back from a 4 day business stay at hotel Polanco. I chose the hotel based on the previous positive reviews on this site. I was quite disapointed. We stayed in 3 other hotels during our trip(similar price range)in Mexico City and this was the worst in terms of customer service, room size, friendliness of staff and business amenities. When we arrived, the guy at the front desk was on the phone for more than 10 minutes (not kidding) simply treating us as if we weren't there. When he hang up, no word of apology - and this was pretty much the reaction of every staff in this hotel during our stay - just totally careless. The internet didn't work during our entire stay - again nobody seemed to care even after our complaint. The bathroom with shower was the smallest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel - you can hardly turn around without hitting something. And last but not least, when we wanted to pay for our stay (with a Company Credit Card) - they told me the card was rejected and we should go to a bank and get cash (with the cab waiting outside). Out of frustration, I gave them my personal Credit Card, which according to them was rejected as well and they kept insisting on cash. Only after I got really irritated with them, they finally called MasterCard, got the authorization code and processed the payment. Obviously, their credit card reader had no connection. On the positive side, the rooms are simple but clean, the restaurant is good but is not affiliated with the hotel (so no breakfast included in the hotel rate) and the area is nice and safe at night to walk.

Reviews.Title: “A great value and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a teacher on a budget, I was pleased that a local contact recommended the Polanco. The room and restaurant were fine, and the staff pleasant and helpful. It is within convenient walking distance from the main tour bus start/stop, and there are beautiful homes, parks, and great shopping areas also close by. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Business travelers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice area and close to much, clean and personal but restaurant opens for Breakfast at 0800hrs, rooms are poorly illuminated (only two ceiling lights) small, small office desk and only one electric outlet (by the bed) in the room and no Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Polanco is a small quite property that affords business travelers great value and clean rooms. I travel to Mexico monthly on business and call Hotel Polanco mi casa. The front desk staff is bi-lingual and helpful. The rooms are a bit small by U.S. standards, but were recently remodeled. An excellent Italian Restaurant (one of the best in the D.F.)is located on the first floor. I have found that may of the guests are repete clients who are doing business in the area. This place is excellent for the budget minded business traveler.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Polanco
HotelInfo.Address: Edgar Allan Poe 8 | Polanco, Mexico City 11560, Mexico
